p: In the early 1970s, Dutch and Turkish cannabis volatile oil samples were compared by capillary gas chromatography [ 98, 99]. The volatile oils were prepared by two methods: hydrodistillation or through nitrogen extraction; the volatile oils were identified to contain 18 total monoterpenes, seven of which had not been identified previously: cis-β-ocimene ( 203), trans-β-ocimene ( 204), α-phellandrene ( 211), Δ 3-carene ( 217), Δ 4-carene ( 218), sabinene ( 219) and α-thujene ( 220). In 1976, the oxygenated monoterpene, m-mentha-1,8-(9)-dien-5-ol ( 229) was identified from the volatile oil of Cannabis [ 100].
